main event: Multiple sightings of flying discs were reported in different locations at different times, including in Chicago, Illinois and Yarmouth Harbor, Nova Scotia, in 1952.
interesting points: A civilian woman in Chicago reported seeing six or seven circular gray objects moving independently and maneuvering on a vertical plane at an altitude of approximately six to seven thousand feet.

In Yarmouth Harbor, Nova Scotia, a vacationing individual observed several silvery flying discs arranged in a symmetrical form, traveling at a high rate of speed and appearing illuminated and slightly flattened as they passed overhead.
The objects seen in Yarmouth Harbor were estimated to be from 15 to 20 feet in diameter and seemed to fly in an erratic manner, sometimes close together and sometimes spread apart.
The witness in Nova Scotia described the day as bright and clear with no clouds in the sky, and provided sketches of the reported objects.
The report was transmitted to the United States Air Force and Central Intelligence Agency for further consideration.
location: Chicago, IL and Yarmouth Harbor, Nova Scotia
